   22: %% File:    os_signal_SUITE.erl
   23: %% Author:  Bj√∂rn-Egil Dahlberg
   24: %% Created: 2017-01-13
   25: %%
   26: 
   27: -module(os_signal_SUITE).
   28: 
   29: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   31: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   32: -export([init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   33: 
   34: -export([set_alarm/1, fork/0, get_exit_code/1]).
   35: 
   36: % Test cases
   37: -export([set_unset/1,
   38:          t_sighup/1,
   39:          t_sigusr1/1,
   40:          t_sigusr2/1,
   41:          t_sigterm/1,
   42:          t_sigalrm/1,
   43:          t_sigchld/1,
   44:          t_sigchld_fork/1,
   45:          t_sigcont/1,
   46:          t_sigwinch/1,
   47:          t_siginfo/1]).
   48: 
   49: -define(signal_server, erl_signal_server).
   50: 
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   53:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   54: 
   55: all() ->
   56:     case os:type() of
   57:         {win32, _} -> [];
   58:         _ -> [t_sighup,
   59:               t_sigusr1,
   60:               t_sigusr2,
   61:               t_sigterm,
   62:               t_sigalrm,
   63:               t_sigchld,
   64:               t_sigchld_fork,
   65:               t_sigwinch,
   66:               t_siginfo,
   67:               set_unset]
   68:     end.
   69: 
   70: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   71:     Pid = erlang:whereis(?signal_server),
   72:     true = erlang:unregister(?signal_server),
   73:     [{signal_server, Pid}|Config].
   74: 
   75: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   76:     case proplists:get_value(signal_server, Config) of
   77:         undefined -> ok;
   78:         Pid ->
   79:             true = erlang:register(?signal_server, Pid),
   80:             ok
   81:     end.
   82: 
   83: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   84:     load_nif(Config),
   85:     Config.
   86: 
   87: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   88:     ok.
   89: 
   90: %% tests
   91: 
   92: set_unset(_Config) ->
   93:     Signals = [sighup, %sigint,
   94:                sigquit, %sigill,
   95:                sigabrt,
   96:                sigalrm, sigterm,
   97:                sigusr1, sigusr2,
   98:                sigchld,
   99:                sigstop, sigtstp, sigcont],
  100:     F1 = fun(Sig) -> ok = os:set_signal(Sig,handle) end,
  101:     F2 = fun(Sig) -> ok = os:set_signal(Sig,default) end,
  102:     F3 = fun(Sig) -> ok = os:set_signal(Sig,ignore) end,
  103:     %% set handle
  104:     ok = lists:foreach(F1, Signals),
  105:     %% set ignore
  106:     ok = lists:foreach(F2, Signals),
  107:     %% set default
  108:     ok = lists:foreach(F3, Signals),
  109:     ok.
  110: 
  111: t_sighup(_Config) ->
  112:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  113:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  114:     os:set_signal(sighup, handle),
  115:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  116:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  117:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  118:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  119:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  120:     [{notify,sighup},
  121:      {notify,sighup},
  122:      {notify,sighup}] = Msgs1,
  123:     %% no proc
  124:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  125:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  126:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  127:     %% ignore
  128:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  129:     os:set_signal(sighup, ignore),
  130:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  131:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  132:     ok = kill("HUP", OsPid),
  133:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  134:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  135:     [] = Msgs2,
  136:     %% reset to handle (it's the default)
  137:     os:set_signal(sighup, handle),
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: t_sigusr1(_Config) ->
  141:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  142:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  143:     % shouldn't need to explicitly set_signal to handle USR1, it's the default
  144:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  145:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  146:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  147:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  148:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  149:     [{notify,sigusr1},
  150:      {notify,sigusr1},
  151:      {notify,sigusr1}] = Msgs1,
  152:     %% no proc
  153:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  154:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  155:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  156:     %% ignore
  157:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  158:     os:set_signal(sigusr1, ignore),
  159:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  160:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  161:     ok = kill("USR1", OsPid),
  162:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  163:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  164:     [] = Msgs2,
  165:     %% reset to handle (default) so as not to break other tests
  166:     os:set_signal(sigusr1, handle),
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: t_sigusr2(_Config) ->
  170:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  171:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  172:     os:set_signal(sigusr2, handle),
  173:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  174:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  175:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  176:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  177:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  178:     [{notify,sigusr2},
  179:      {notify,sigusr2},
  180:      {notify,sigusr2}] = Msgs1,
  181:     %% no proc
  182:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  183:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  184:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  185:     %% ignore
  186:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  187:     os:set_signal(sigusr2, ignore),
  188:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  189:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  190:     ok = kill("USR2", OsPid),
  191:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  192:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  193:     [] = Msgs2,
  194:     %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  195:     os:set_signal(sigusr2, ignore),
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: t_sigterm(_Config) ->
  199:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  200:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  201:     os:set_signal(sigterm, handle),
  202:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  203:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  204:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  205:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  206:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  207:     [{notify,sigterm},
  208:      {notify,sigterm},
  209:      {notify,sigterm}] = Msgs1,
  210:     %% no proc
  211:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  212:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  213:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  214:     %% ignore
  215:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  216:     os:set_signal(sigterm, ignore),
  217:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  218:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  219:     ok = kill("TERM", OsPid),
  220:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  221:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  222:     [] = Msgs2,
  223:     %% reset to handle (it's the default)
  224:     os:set_signal(sigterm, handle),
  225:     ok.
  226: 
  227: t_sigchld(_Config) ->
  228:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  229:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  230:     os:set_signal(sigchld, handle),
  231:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  232:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  233:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  234:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  235:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  236:     [{notify,sigchld},
  237:      {notify,sigchld},
  238:      {notify,sigchld}] = Msgs1,
  239:     %% no proc
  240:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  241:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  242:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  243:     %% ignore
  244:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  245:     os:set_signal(sigchld, ignore),
  246:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  247:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  248:     ok = kill("CHLD", OsPid),
  249:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  250:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  251:     [] = Msgs2,
  252:     %% reset to handle (it's the default)
  253:     os:set_signal(sigchld, ignore),
  254:     ok.
  255: 
  256: 
  257: t_sigalrm(_Config) ->
  258:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  259:     ok = os:set_signal(sigalrm, handle),
  260:     ok = os_signal_SUITE:set_alarm(1),
  261:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  262:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  263:     [{notify,sigalrm}] = Msgs1,
  264:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  265:     os:set_signal(sigalrm, ignore),
  266:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  267:     ok = os_signal_SUITE:set_alarm(1),
  268:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  269:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  270:     [] = Msgs2,
  271:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  272:     Pid3 = setup_service(),
  273:     os:set_signal(sigalrm, handle),
  274:     ok = os_signal_SUITE:set_alarm(1),
  275:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  276:     Msgs3 = fetch_msgs(Pid3),
  277:     [{notify,sigalrm}] = Msgs3,
  278:     io:format("Msgs3: ~p~n", [Msgs3]),
  279:     os:set_signal(sigalrm, ignore),
  280:     ok.
  281: 
  282: t_sigchld_fork(_Config) ->
  283:     case test_server:is_asan() of
  284: 	true ->
  285: 	    %% Avoid false leak reports from forked process
  286: 	    {skip, "Address sanitizer"};
  287: 	false ->
  288: 	    sigchld_fork()
  289:     end.
  290: 
  291: sigchld_fork() ->
  292:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  293:     ok = os:set_signal(sigchld, handle),
  294:     {ok,OsPid} = os_signal_SUITE:fork(),
  295:     receive after 3000 -> ok end,
  296:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  297:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  298:     [{notify,sigchld}] = Msgs1,
  299:     {ok,Status} = os_signal_SUITE:get_exit_code(OsPid),
  300:     io:format("exit status from ~w : ~w~n", [OsPid,Status]),
  301:     42 = Status,
  302:     %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  303:     os:set_signal(sigchld, ignore),
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: t_sigcont(_Config) ->
  307:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  308:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  309:     os:set_signal(sigcont, handle),
  310:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  311:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  312:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  313:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  314:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  315:     [{notify,sigcont},
  316:      {notify,sigcont},
  317:      {notify,sigcont}] = Msgs1,
  318:     %% no proc
  319:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  320:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  321:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  322:     %% ignore
  323:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  324:     os:set_signal(sigcont, ignore),
  325:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  326:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  327:     ok = kill("CONT", OsPid),
  328:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  329:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  330:     [] = Msgs2,
  331:     %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  332:     os:set_signal(sigcont, ignore),
  333:     ok.
  334: 
  335: t_sigwinch(_Config) ->
  336:     Pid1 = setup_service(),
  337:     OsPid = os:getpid(),
  338:     os:set_signal(sigwinch, handle),
  339:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  340:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  341:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  342:     Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  343:     io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  344:     [{notify,sigwinch},
  345:      {notify,sigwinch},
  346:      {notify,sigwinch}] = Msgs1,
  347:     %% no proc
  348:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  349:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  350:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  351:     %% ignore
  352:     Pid2 = setup_service(),
  353:     os:set_signal(sigwinch, ignore),
  354:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  355:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  356:     ok = kill("WINCH", OsPid),
  357:     Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  358:     io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  359:     [] = Msgs2,
  360:     %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  361:     os:set_signal(sigwinch, ignore),
  362:     ok.
  363: 
  364: t_siginfo(_Config) ->
  365:     SiginfoSupported = try
  366:                            os:set_signal(siginfo, default),
  367:                            true
  368:                        catch
  369:                            error:badarg ->
  370:                                false
  371:                        end,
  372:     case SiginfoSupported of
  373:         true ->
  374:             Pid1 = setup_service(),
  375:             OsPid = os:getpid(),
  376:             os:set_signal(siginfo, handle),
  377:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  378:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  379:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  380:             Msgs1 = fetch_msgs(Pid1),
  381:             io:format("Msgs1: ~p~n", [Msgs1]),
  382:             [{notify,siginfo},
  383:              {notify,siginfo},
  384:              {notify,siginfo}] = Msgs1,
  385:             %% no proc
  386:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  387:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  388:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  389:             %% ignore
  390:             Pid2 = setup_service(),
  391:             os:set_signal(siginfo, ignore),
  392:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  393:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  394:             ok = kill("INFO", OsPid),
  395:             Msgs2 = fetch_msgs(Pid2),
  396:             io:format("Msgs2: ~p~n", [Msgs2]),
  397:             [] = Msgs2,
  398:             %% reset to ignore (it's the default)
  399:             os:set_signal(siginfo, ignore);
  400:         false ->
  401:             ok
  402:     end,
  403:     ok.
  404: 
  405: 
  406: %% nif stubs
  407: 
  408: set_alarm(_Secs) -> no.
  409: fork() -> no.
  410: get_exit_code(_OsPid) -> no.
  411: 
  412: %% aux
  413: 
  414: setup_service() ->
  415:     Pid = spawn_link(fun msgs/0),
  416:     true = erlang:register(?signal_server, Pid),
  417:     Pid.
  418: 
  419: msgs() ->
  420:     msgs([]).
  421: msgs(Ms) ->
  422:     receive
  423:         {Pid, fetch_msgs} -> Pid ! {self(), lists:reverse(Ms)};
  424:         Msg ->
  425:             msgs([Msg|Ms])
  426:     end.
  427: 
  428: fetch_msgs(Pid) ->
  429:     Pid ! {self(), fetch_msgs},
  430:     receive {Pid, Msgs} -> Msgs end.
  431: 
  432: kill(Signal, Pid) ->
  433:     {0,_} = run("kill", ["-s", Signal, Pid]),
  434:     receive after 200 -> ok end,
  435:     ok.
  436: 
  437: load_nif(Config) ->
  438:     Path = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  439:     case erlang:load_nif(filename:join(Path,"os_signal_nif"), 0) of
  440:         ok -> ok;
  441:         {error,{reload,_}} -> ok
  442:     end.
  443: 
  444: run(Program0, Args) -> run(".", Program0, Args).
  445: run(Cwd, Program0, Args) when is_list(Cwd) ->
  446:     Program = case os:find_executable(Program0) of
  447:                   Path when is_list(Path) ->
  448:                       Path;
  449:                   false ->
  450:                       exit(no)
  451:               end,
  452:     Options = [{args,Args},binary,exit_status,stderr_to_stdout,
  453:                {line,4096}, {cd, Cwd}],
  454:     try open_port({spawn_executable,Program}, Options) of
  455:         Port ->
  456:             run_loop(Port, [])
  457:     catch
  458:         error:_ ->
  459:                       exit(no)
  460:     end.
  461: 
  462: run_loop(Port, Output) ->
  463:     receive
  464:         {Port,{exit_status,Status}} ->
  465:             {Status,lists:reverse(Output)};
  466:         {Port,{data,{eol,Bin}}} ->
  467:             run_loop(Port, [Bin|Output]);
  468:         _Msg ->
  469:             run_loop(Port, Output)
  470:     end.
